title: Can we get Gangplank now?
body:
It's frustrating to have him disabled for such a silly reason.

Reminder: Lore is important, but League of Legends is a **game** first and foremost. Lore should never take away from the game.

replies.body: I agree that it was a cool and new idea they wanted to try, and I was completely fine with the first day that he was disabled. The second day was a bit concerning,  but I thought they wanted to let it really sink in to some people. But three, going on four days of refusing someone access to a champion that they may really enjoy playing is really upsetting. I really hope they have some super bad ass skin or something for him when he comes back, because if not, a lot of people are going to be upset. I know personally, if that stunt where pulled with Udyr, I would be complaining so damn hard, and be so infuriated. Although I myself dont too much care for Gangplank, I know there are people that love him just as much as I love Udyr, so I can understand them being upset.

He is getting a new base, and current new captain base is becoming a new skin.
So technically -- yes?

Just to be clear.  You're upset that rito is giving you an awesome  free skin and it took us longer than we intended to get it out.  So we should never, ever do that again.

To say that means you either don't visit the forums that often, or you haven't been here more than a year at most.

I've been here for about 5 years now, and I can tell you, the past 3 and a half years, riot has completely stopped listening to the MAJORITY of negative feedback (I say majority, because that isn't the same as none at all). 

They have become very good at tuning out what they don't want to hear and have become very good at only tuning in and responding to what they do, and this has bit them in the backside plenty of times. Then they just end up going back and fixing things that people were giving them "negative" feedback on.

Also I'm not a kid, so take your suck up attitude and your butthurt"ness" elsewhere. The majority of the negative feedback I've seen (outside of the idiots saying "I hope you are fired" are correct and justified. 

I'm sorry but after years of disappointment and lost trust, I'm not gonna go "thanks Riot for screwing this up again because you refuse to listen to your playerbase". No I'm gonna state my opinion like an adult - because I have the right, and if people don't state what they dislike, Riot will just assume people like everything, even the stuff they royally mess up.

People are/were annoyed because it is Sunday and it has been since Wednesday.

It isn't one way or the other. I get that. I get that a lot of effort went into the skin, the event, everything. But when you take something from someone, something they purchased, that's scary. Yeah, you have the right to do it in the ~~EULA~~ TOS, yeah yeah. That doesn't make people feel better when all of a sudden they find that something they purchased has been taken away from them without a gamplay related reason. Riot hasn't had the best of track records on communication in the past. There isn't a whole lot of trust. Especially in Lore. That's hard to hear, I know, since I now see you are a Writer (I was on my phone before). But a fair number of people tend to be afraid of what Riot does, be it is my main going to get nerfed next or have his/her/its lore completely removed/retconned and then ignored for months going on years. 

You got to see people working hard and putting in a lot of effort. All we got to see was Rioters going "Yep he's dead." for several days and waiting anxiously for any thing at all. There was a massive conspiracy theory going around for a while that he was disabled due to a bug with his E barrels and Draven. People didn't even want to believe Riot would disable a champ without a gameplay reason. So I get that you are angry and don't feel like your/other Rioters' hard work is appreciated. But please remember that we fear you more than we trust you.
